term.name: Manicheism
term.source: From the name of the Persian theologian Mani (3rd century CE).
term.def: A religious sect (similar in its &dualism; to &gnosticism;) claiming to supersede &christianity;, &zoroastrianism;, and &buddhism;; Manicheism held that good and evil are co-eternal and equally powerful forces in the universe.
